lead_paragraph: The count has long been long viewed as a measure of China’s rising global power, and an uneven showing in the Rio Games has smarted.

byline.contributor: Emily Feng, Carolyn Zhang and Adam Wu contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Dismay in China Over a Declining Medal Count
headline.main: Lower Medal Count in Rio Rattles China’s Olympics Obsession

snippet: The count has long been long viewed as a measure of China’s rising global power, and an uneven showing in the Rio Games has smarted....
abstract: Decline in number of overall Olympic medals won by Chinese athletes at 2016 Rio Games in comparison to other Olympics is seen by some as blemish on national pride; others question whether sacrifice demanded of athletes and taxpayers is worth it, given country's other challenges.
